qas.question: What percentage of the National GDP does the Federal District produce?
What is the GDP of Mexico City?
What ranking in terms of GDP is Mexico City globally?
What percentage of service sector national GDP does Mexico City account for?
By what year will the Mexico City GDP double by, according to research?

context: Mexico City is one of the most important economic hubs in Latin America. The city proper (Federal District) produces <a0_0>15.8<a0_0/>% of the country's gross domestic product. According to a study conducted by PwC, Mexico City had a GDP of <a1_0>$390 billion<a1_0/>, ranking it as the <a2_0>eighth<a2_0/> richest city in the world after the greater metropolitan areas of Tokyo, New York City, Los Angeles, Chicago, Paris, London and Osaka/Kobe (and the richest in the whole of Latin America). Excluding the rest of the Mexican economy, Mexico City alone would rank as the 30th largest economy in the world. Mexico City is the greatest contributor to the country's industrial GDP (15.8%) and also the greatest contributor to the country's GDP in the service sector (<a3_0>25.3<a3_0/>%). Due to the limited non-urbanized space at the south—most of which is protected through environmental laws—the contribution of the Federal District in agriculture is the smallest of all federal entities in the country. Mexico City has one of the world's fastest-growing economies and its GDP is set to double by <a4_0>2020<a4_0/>.
